sen.j: 八部衆（はちぶしゅう）または天龍八部衆（てんりゅうはちぶしゅう）は、仏法を守護する8神。
sen.e: Hachibushu or Tenryu Hachibushu is eight deities who guard Buddhism.
Hachibushu or Tenryu Hachibushu refers to eight deities who guard Buddhism.
Hachibushu or Tenryu Hachibushu refers to eight deities who guard Buddhism.

sen.j: 仏教が流布する以前の古代インドの鬼神、戦闘神、音楽神、動物神などが仏教に帰依し、護法善神となったものである。
sen.e: The ancient Indian gods such as fierce god, war god, music god and animal god before dissemination of Buddhism, became to believe Buddhism and transformed to Goho Zenshin, good deities protecting dharma (護法善神).

The ancient Indian gods such as the fierce god, the war god, the music god and the animal god, before the dissemination of Buddhism, came to believe in Buddhism and transformed to Goho Zenshin, good deities protecting dharma (護法善神).

The ancient Indian gods such as the fierce god, the war god, the music god and the animal god, before the dissemination of Buddhism, came to believe in Buddhism and transformed to Goho zenjin (good deities protecting dharma).
sen.cmt: 用語の訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 八部衆とは8つの種族という意味である。
sen.e: Hachibushu means eight species.
Hachibushu means eight species.
Hachibushu means eight species.

sen.j: これにはいくつかの説がある。
sen.e: For this, there are various theories.
For this, there are various theories.
For this, there are various theories.

sen.j: 通常に用いられるのは「舎利弗問経」を基本に、「法華経」や「金光明最勝王経」などの説により、天部衆、龍衆、夜叉衆、乾闥婆衆、阿修羅衆、迦楼羅衆、緊那羅衆、摩睺羅伽衆の8つを指す。
sen.e: Usually it means following eight deities based on mainly 'Sharihotsumon-kyo Sutra,' and 'Hoke-kyo Sutra' and 'Konkoosaishomyo-kyo Sutra' as well; Tembushu (Deities who reside in a heavenly realm, one of six realms in which the souls of living beings transmigrate from one to another), Ryushu (Pre-Buddhist snake or dragon deities), Yashashu (a class of semidivine being usually considered to be of a benevolent and inoffensive disposition but sometimes also classed with malignant spirits), Kendatsubashu (Gandharva), Karurashu (Garuda), Kinnarashu (Kimnara) and Makoragashu (Mahoraga).

Usually it means the following eight deities based on mainly 'Sharihotsumon-kyo Sutra,' and 'Hoke-kyo Sutra' and 'Konkoosaishomyo-kyo Sutra' as well; Tembushu (Deities who reside in a heavenly realm, one of the six realms in which the souls of living beings transmigrate from one to another), Ryushu (Pre-Buddhist snake or dragon deities), Yashashu (a class of semidivine usually considered to be of a benevolent and inoffensive disposition but sometimes also classed with malignant spirits), Kendatsubashu (Gandharva), Karurashu (Garuda), Kinnarashu (Kimnara) and Makoragashu (Mahoraga).

Usually it means the following eight deities based on mainly 'Sharihotsumon-kyo Sutra,' and 'Hoke-kyo Sutra' and 'Konkomyo Saisho-kyo Sutra' as well; Tenbushu (Deities who reside in a heavenly realm, one of the six realms in which the souls of living beings transmigrate from one to another), Ryushu (Pre-Buddhist snake or dragon deities), Yashashu (a class of semi divine usually considered to be of a benevolent and inoffensive disposition but sometimes also classed with malignant spirits), Kendatsubashu (Gandharva), Karurashu (Garuda), Kinnarashu (Kinnara) and Makoragashu (Mahoraga).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: ただし、奈良・興福寺の著名な八部衆像の各像の名称は上述のものと異なり、寺伝では五部浄、沙羯羅（さから、しゃがら）、鳩槃荼（くはんだ）、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦楼羅、緊那羅、畢婆迦羅（ひばから）と呼ばれている。
sen.e: However, each name of famous Hachibushu statues of Kofuku-ji Temple in Nara is different from those above, and according to the temple's tradition, they are called Gobujo, Sakara (Shagara), Kuhanda, Kendatsuba, Ashura, Karura, Kinnara and Hibakara.

However, the names of the famous Hachibushu statues of Kofuku-ji Temple in Nara are different from those above, and according to the tradition of the temple, they are called Gobujo, Sakara (Shagara), Kuhanda, Kendatsuba, Ashura, Karura, Kinnara and Hibakara.

However, the names of the famous Hachibushu statues of Kofuku-ji Temple in Nara Prefecture are different from those above, and according to the temple legend, they are called Gobujo, Sakara (Shagara), Kuhanda, Kendatsuba, Ashura, Karura, Kinnara and Hibakara.

sen.j: なお、四天王に仕える八部鬼衆は、これらの八部衆と名称も類似し一部重複するので間違われやすいが基本的に異なる。
sen.e: In addition, Hachibukishu who serve Shitenno, Four Guardian Kings, are often confused with these Hachibushu because they have similar names to Hachibushu and some of them have the same names but they are different deities basically.

In addition, Hachibukishu who serve Shitenno, the Four Guardian Kings, are often confused with these Hachibushu because they have similar names to Hachibushu and some of them have the same names but they are different deities basically.

In addition, Hachibukishu (eight fierce gods) who serve Shitenno (the Four Guardian Kings), are often confused with these Hachibushu because they have similar names to Hachibushu and some of them have the same names but they are different deities basically.
sen.cmt: 用語の英訳を補足しました。

sen.j: ちなみに八部鬼衆は、乾闥婆・毘舎闍・鳩槃荼・薛茘多・那伽（龍）・富單那・夜叉・羅刹の名を挙げる。
sen.e: Incidentally, Hachibukishu include Kendatsuba, Bishaja, Kuhanda, Heireita, Naga, Futanna, Yasha and Rasetsu (Rakshasa).
Incidentally, Hachibukishu include Kendatsuba, Bishaja, Kuhanda, Heireita, Naga, Futanna, Yasha and Rasetsu (Rakshasa).
Incidentally, Hachibukishu include Kendatsuba, Bishaja, Kuhanda, Heireita, Naga, Futanna, Yasha and Rasetsu (Rakshasa).

sen.j: 法華経の序品（じょぼん）には、聴衆として比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷（出家在家の男女）などの「人」のほかに、この八部衆を「非人」として名が連ねられている。
sen.e: In Jobon of Hoke-kyo Sutra, the names of this Hachibushu are seen as 'nonhuman entity' in addition to 'human' such as Biku (Buddhist priest), Bikuni (female Buddhist disciple), Ubasoku and Ubai as audience.

In Jobon of Hoke-kyo Sutra, the names of these Hachibushu are seen as 'nonhuman entitities' in addition to 'humans' such as Biku (Buddhist priest), Bikuni (female Buddhist disciple), Ubasoku and Ubai as the audience.

In Jobon (chapter 1, Introductory) of Hoke-kyo Sutra, the names of these Hachibushu are seen as 'nonhuman entities' in addition to 'humans' such as Biku (Buddhist priest), Bikuni (female Buddhist disciple), Ubasoku (upasaka) and Ubai (upasika) (devout men and women lay follower of Buddhism) as the audience.

sen.j: 天（Deva、てん）

Ten, Deva
Ten, Deva

sen.j: 梵天、帝釈天をはじめとする、いわゆる「天部」の神格の総称。
sen.e: It is an inclusive term of so-called 'Tembu' such as Bonten and Taishakuten.
It is an inclusive term of so-called 'Tembu' such as Bonten and Taishakuten.
It is an inclusive term of so-called 'Tenbu' (deities of Buddhism) such as Bonten (Brahma, a major Hindu deity thought to be responsible for creating the world) and Taishakuten (Sakra devanam Indra).

sen.j: 欲界の六天、色界の四禅天、無色界の四空処天のこと。
sen.e: It means six heavens of Yokkai (the realm of desire), fourth dhyana heaven of Shikikai (the realm of form) and Shikushoten (four realms of the world of formlessness) of Mushikikai (the realm of non-form).

It has the meaning of light, nature, purity, freedom and victory (最勝).

sen.j: 興福寺の八部衆像
sen.e: The statues of Hachibushu in Kofuku-ji Temple
The statues of Hachibushu in Kofuku-ji Temple
The statues of Hachibushu in Kofuku-ji Temple

sen.j: 日本における八部衆像の作例としては、奈良・興福寺の旧 西金堂（さいこんどう）安置像（奈良時代、国宝）がよく知られる。
sen.e: As works of the Hachibushu statues in Japan, the statues at Saikon-do (an image hall situated to the west of a pagoda in temple grounds) of Kofuku-ji Temple in Nara (Nara Period, national treasures) are well known.

As works of the Hachibushu statues in Japan, the statues at Saikon-do (an image hall situated to the west of a pagoda in the temple grounds) of Kofuku-ji Temple in Nara (Nara Period, national treasures) are well known.

As works of the Hachibushu statues in Japan, the statues at former Saikon-do (an image hall situated to the west of a pagoda in the temple grounds) of Kofuku-ji Temple in Nara Prefecture (Nara period, national treasures) are well known.

sen.j: この他には、涅槃図などの絵画作品に諸菩薩や釈尊の弟子たちとともに描かれる場合があり、法隆寺五重塔初層北面の釈迦涅槃を表わした塑像群の中にも阿修羅をはじめとする八部衆の姿が認められるが、彫像の作例は他にほとんど見ない。
sen.e: Besides them, in some cases Hachibushu are drawn on pictures such as Nehan-zu (Nirvana painting) with other disciples of Sakyamuni and they are also seen in the statues which show nirvana of Shaka on the north side of the first story of Horyu-ji Temple Gojyu-no-to (five-storied pagoda) including Ashura, but other works of statues are rarely seen.

Besides them, in some cases Hachibushu are drawn on pictures such as Nehan-zu (Nirvana painting) with other disciples of Sakyamuni and they are also seen in statues which show nirvana of Shaka on the north side of the first story of Horyu-ji Temple Gojyu-no-to (five-storied pagoda) including Ashura, but other statues are rarely seen.

Besides them, sometimes Hachibushu are drawn on pictures with other disciples of Shakyamuni, such as Nehan-zu (Nirvana painting), and their statues including Ashura are seen in statues on the north side of the first story of Goju-no-to (five-storey pagoda) of Horyu-ji Temple, which show nirvana of Shaka, but other statues are rarely seen.

sen.j: 千手観音の眷属である二十八部衆（日本での代表的な作例は京都・三十三間堂、同・清水寺など）のうちにも八部衆に相当する像が包含されている。
sen.e: Nijuhachibushu, the twenty-eight attendants which are Kenzoku of Senju Kannon (Sahasrabhuja-arya-avalokites 'vara, "Thousand-armed Kannon") (representative works in Japan are statues at Sanjusangendo Temple, Kiyomizu-dera Temple in Kyoto and so on) include statues of Hachibushu.

Nijuhachibushu, the twenty-eight attendants which are Kenzoku of Senju Kannon (Sahasrabhuja-arya-avalokites 'vara, "Thousand-armed Kannon") (representative works in Japan are statues at Sanjusangendo Temple, Kiyomizu-dera Temple in Kyoto and so on) include statues of Hachibushu.

Nijuhachibushu, the twenty-eight attendants which are Kenzoku of Senju Kannon (Sahasrabhuja-arya-avalokites 'vara, "Thousand-armed Kannon") (representative works in Japan are statues at Sanjusangendo Temple and those at Kiyomizu-dera Temple in Kyoto Prefecture) include statues of Hachibushu.

sen.j: 興福寺の八部衆像は麻布を漆で貼り重ねた乾漆造で、廃絶した西金堂に安置されていた。
sen.e: The Hachibushu statues of Kofuku-ji Temple are made by kanshitsu-zukuri which is a technique to put linen cloths with lacquer, and had been placed at Saikon-do which was abolished later.
The Hachibushu statues of Kofuku-ji Temple are made by kanshitsu-zukuri, which is a technique to treat linen cloth with lacquer, and had been placed at Saikon-do which was abolished later.

The Hachibushu statues of Kofuku-ji Temple are made by kanshitsu-zukuri, which is a technique of pasting hemp clothes in layers with lacquer were and had been placed at Saikon-do hall which was abolished later.

sen.j: 西金堂は光明皇后が亡母橘三千代の追善のため天平6年（734年）建立したもので、本尊釈迦三尊像を中心に、梵天・帝釈天像、八部衆像、十大弟子像などが安置されていたことが知られる。
sen.e: Saikon-do was build by Empress Komyo in 734 for memorial service of her late mother TACHIBANA no Michiyo, and it is known that it placed Honzon, principal image of Shaka triad at the center with the statue of Bonten and Taishakuten, Hachibushu statues, the statue of Judai deshi (the Ten Chief Disciples of the historical Buddha, Sakyamuni) and so on.

Saikon-do was build by Empress Komyo in 734 for the memorial service of her late mother TACHIBANA no Michiyo, and it is known that it placed Honzon, the principal image of the Shaka triad, at the center with the statue of Bonten and Taishakuten, Hachibushu statues, the statue of Judai deshi (the Ten Chief Disciples of the historical Buddha, Sakyamuni) and so on.

Saikon-do was build by Empress Komyo in 734 for the memorial service of her late mother TACHIBANA no Michiyo, and is known that the Shaka triad as the principal image, as well as statues of Bonten and Taishakuten, Hachibushu statues, the statue of Judai deshi (the Ten Chief Disciples of the historical Buddha, Shakyamuni) were placed.

sen.j: 京都国立博物館蔵の「興福寺曼荼羅図」（平安末～鎌倉初期、重文）を見ると、八部衆像は本尊の左右前方と後方に各2体ずつ安置されていたことがわかる。
sen.e: Kofuku-ji Temple Mandara picture' in the Kyoto National Museum (from the end of Heian Period to the beginning of Kamakura Period, important cultural property) shows that each two statues of Hachibushu were placed at the right and left of the front and back of Honzon statue.

Kofuku-ji Temple Mandara picture' in the Kyoto National Museum (from the end of the Heian Period to the beginning of the Kamakura Period, important cultural property) shows that each of the two statues of Hachibushu were placed at the right and left of the front and back of the Honzon statue.

Kofuku-ji Temple Mandala picture' in the Kyoto National Museum (from the end of the Heian period to the beginning of the Kamakura period, important cultural property) shows that each two statues of Hachibushu were placed at the right and left in the front and rear of the principal image respectively.

sen.j: 八部衆を含む興福寺西金堂諸像については、法華経序品ではなく、金光明最勝王経所説に基づく造像だと解釈されている。
sen.e: The statues at Kofuku-ji Temple Saikon-do including Hachibushu are interpreted to have been produced based on Konkoosaishomyo-kyo Sutra instead of Jobon of Hoke-kyo Sutra.
The statues at Kofuku-ji Temple Saikon-do including Hachibushu are interpreted to have been produced based on Konkoosaishomyo-kyo Sutra instead of Jobon of Hoke-kyo Sutra.

The statues at Saikon-do of Kofuku-ji Temple including Hachibushu are interpreted to have been produced based on Konkomyo saisho-kyo (Golden Light Sutra of the Most Victorious Kings) instead of Jobon of Hoke-kyo Sutra.
sen.cmt: 用語の英訳を補足しました。参考サイトhttp://books.google.co.jp/books?id=HAoZ-BELposC&pg=PA101&dq=konkomyo+saisho+kyo&lr=&as_brr=3#v=onepage&q=konkomyo%20saisho%20kyo&f=false

sen.j: 以下に興福寺の八部衆像について略説する。
sen.e: Summary account of the Hachibushu statues in Kofuku-ji Temple is following.
A summary account of the Hachibushu statues in Kofuku-ji Temple is as follows.
A summary account of the Hachibushu statues in Kofuku-ji Temple is as follows.

sen.j: 五部浄像 - 色界最上位の色究竟天とその下の天部である五部浄居天のこと。
sen.e: The statue of Gobujo - Shikikukyoten (heaven of the most rarefied form) in the highest grade of Shikikai and Gobujo Goten, a Tembu in the under grade.
The statue of Gobujo - Shikikukyoten (heaven of the most rarefied form) in the highest grade of Shikikai and Gobujo Goten, a Tembu of the lower grade.
The statue of Gobujo - Shikikukyoten (heaven of the most rarefied form) in the highest grade of Shikikai and Gobujo Goten, a Tenbu of the lower grade.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 象頭の冠をかぶり、少年のような表情に造られている。
sen.e: It is shaped to put on a crown with elephant's head and expression like a boy.
It is shaped to put on a crown with an elephant's head and an expression like a boy.
It is shaped to put on a crown with an elephant's head and an expression like a boy.

sen.j: 興福寺像は頭部と上半身の一部を残すのみで大破している（他に、本像の右手部分が東京国立博物館に所蔵されているが、これは1904年（明治37年）、個人の所有者から当時の帝室博物館に寄贈されたものである）。
sen.e: The statue of Kofuku-ji Temple is badly damaged remaining only head and a part of upperbody (besides this, the right hand of this statue is in the possession of Tokyo National Museum, which was donated by an individual owner in 1904 to Imperial Museum at that time).

The statue of Kofuku-ji Temple is badly damaged and only the head and a part of the upperbody remains (besides this, the right hand of this statue is in the possession of Tokyo National Museum, which was donated by an individual owner in 1904 to the then Imperial Museum).

The statue of Kofuku-ji Temple is badly damaged and only the head and a part of the upper body are remained (besides this, the right hand of this statue is in the possession of Tokyo National Museum, which was donated by an individual owner in 1904 to the then Imperial Museum).

sen.j: 経典に説く「天」に当たる像と考えられる。
sen.e: It seems to be the statue which corresponds to 'Ten' in scriptures.
It seems to be the statue which corresponds to 'Ten' in scriptures.
It seems to be the statue which corresponds to 'Ten' in scriptures.

sen.j: 千手観音の眷属の二十八部衆のうちには「五部浄居天」という像があるが、三十三間堂、清水寺本堂などの五部浄居天像は両手に1本ずつの刀を持つ武神像である。
sen.e: Among Nijuhachibushu, which are Kenzoku of Senju Kannon, there is the statue of 'Gobujo Goten,' and the statues of Gobujo Goten in Sanjusangendo Temple and Kiyomizu-dera Temple main hall are war gods which have a sword in each hand.

Among Nijuhachibushu, which are Kenzoku of Senju Kannon, there is the statue of 'Gobujo Goten,' and the statues of Gobujo Goten in Sanjusangendo Temple and Kiyomizu-dera Temple main hall, are war gods which have a sword in each hand.

Among Nijuhachibushu of Senju Kannon's Kenzoku, there is the statue of 'Gobujo Goten,' and some of them are of war gods with a sword in each hand, including in Sanjusangendo Temple and the main hall of Kiyomizu-dera Temple.

sen.j: 沙羯羅像 - 頭頂から上半身にかけて蛇が巻きつき、憂いを帯びた少年のような表情に造られている。
sen.e: The statue of Sakatsura - it is shaped as a figure that a snake is coiled up from the top of the head to upperbody and it has a sad look on its face like a boy.
The statue of Sakatsura - it is shaped as a figure where a snake is coiled up from the top of the head to the upperbody and it has a sad look on its face like a boy.
The statue of Sakatsura - it is shaped as a figure where a snake is wound around from the top of the head to the upper body and it has a sad look on its face like a boy.

sen.j: 本像は、経典に説く「竜」に当たる像と考えられている。
sen.e: This statue is considered to be the statue which corresponds to 'dragon' in scriptures.
This statue is considered to be the statue which corresponds to 'dragon' in scriptures.
This statue is considered to be the statue which corresponds to 'dragon' in scriptures.

sen.j: ただし、興福寺の沙羯羅像を「竜」でなく「摩睺羅伽」に該当するものだとする説もある。
sen.e: However, there is a theory that the state of Sakatsura in Kofuku-ji Temple corresponds to 'Makoraga' instead of 'dragon.'
However, there is a theory that the state of Sakatsura in Kofuku-ji Temple corresponds to 'Makoraga' instead of 'dragon.'

sen.j: 二十八部衆には「沙羯羅竜王」の名で登場する。
sen.e: It appears in the name of 'Sakatsura Ryuo' among Nijuhachibushu.
It appears in the name of 'Sakatsura Ryuo' among Nijuhachibushu.
It appears in the name of 'Sakatsura Ryuo' among Nijuhachibushu.

sen.j: 鳩槃荼像 - 頭髪が逆立ち、目を吊り上げた怒りの表情に造られている。
sen.e: The statue of Kuhanda - it is shaped in the expression of anger with its hair stand on end and its eyes narrow.
The statue of Kuhanda - it is shaped in the expression of anger with its hair stood on end and its eyes narrow.
The statue of Kuhanda - it is shaped in the expression of anger with its hair stood on end and its eyes narrow.

sen.j: 経典に説く「夜叉」に相当する像とされている。
sen.e: It is considered to be the statue which corresponds to 'Yasha' in scriptures.
It is considered to be the statue which corresponds to 'Yasha' in scriptures.
It is considered to be the statue which corresponds to 'Yasha' in scriptures.

sen.j: 四天王のうちの増長天の眷属ともいう。
sen.e: It is also said to be Kenzoku of Zochoten, Virudhaka, among Shitenno.
It is also said to be Kenzoku of Zochoten, Virudhaka, among Shitenno.

sen.j: 二十八部衆のうちには鳩槃荼に該当する像がない。
sen.e: There is no statue which corresponds to Kuhanda among Nijuhachibushu.
There is no statue which corresponds to Kuhanda among Nijuhachibushu.

sen.j: 乾闥婆像 - 獅子冠をかぶる着甲像である。
sen.e: The statue of Kendatsuba - it puts on armor and lion crown.
The statue of Kendatsuba - it puts on armor and a lion crown.
The statue of Kendatsuba - it puts on armor and a lion crown.

sen.j: 両目はほとんど閉じられている。
sen.e: Both eyes are almost closed.
Both eyes are almost closed.
Both eyes are almost closed.

sen.j: 阿修羅像 - 三面六臂に表わされる。
sen.e: The statue of Ashura - it is shaped as a figure with three faces and six arms.
The statue of Ashura - it is shaped as a figure with three faces and six arms.
The statue of Ashura - it is shaped as a figure with three faces and six arms.

sen.j: 興福寺の阿修羅像は、奈良観光のポスター、パンフレットにしばしば取り上げられる著名な像である。
sen.e: The Ashura statue of Kofuku-ji Temple is famous, which is often appeared in poster and brochure for sightseeing of Nara.
The Ashura statue of Kofuku-ji Temple is famous, which is why it often appears in posters and brochures for sightseeing in Nara.

sen.j: 迦楼羅像 - 興福寺像は鳥頭人身の着甲像である。
sen.e: The statue of Karura - the statue of Kofuku-ji Temple puts on armor with bird's head and human body.
The statue of Karura - the statue of Kofuku-ji Temple, wears armor with a bird's head and a human body.
The statue of Karura - the statue of Kofuku-ji Temple wears armor with a bird's head and a human body.

sen.j: 三十三間堂、清水寺本堂の二十八部衆中の迦楼羅王像は異なって翼を持ち、笛を吹く姿に造られている。
sen.e: Different from this, the statue of Karura among Nijuhachibushu at Sanjusangendo Temple and Kiyomizu-dera Temple have wings and blow a whistle.
Different from this, the statue of Karura among Nijuhachibushu at Sanjusangendo Temple and Kiyomizu-dera Temple have wings and blow a whistle.
Different from this, the statues of Karura among Nijuhachibushu at Sanjusangendo Temple and the main hall of Kiyomizu-dera Temple have wings and blow a whistle.

sen.j: 緊那羅像 - 頭上に一角があり、寺伝とおり、当初から緊那羅像として造られたものと思われる。
sen.e: The statue of Kinnara - it has a horn on the head and seems to have been made as the statue of Kinnara from the very beginning as the tradition of temple shows.
The statue of Kinnara - it has a horn on the head and seems to have been made as the statue of Kinnara from the very beginning as the tradition of the temple shows.

sen.j: 畢婆迦羅像 - 他の像と異なり、やや老相に造られ、あごひげをたくわえている。
sen.e: The statue of Hibakara - it has shaped as somewhat older face with a beard, different from other statues.
The statue of Hibakara - it is shaped as a somewhat older face with a beard, different from other statues.
The statue of Hibakara - it is shaped as a somewhat older face with a beard, different from other statues.

sen.j: 経典に説く「摩睺羅伽」に相当するものとされるが、定かでない。
sen.e: It is said to correspond to 'Makoraga' in scripture, which is not sure.
It is said to correspond to 'Makoraga' in scripture, but it is not sure.

sen.j: 二十八部衆のうちには畢婆迦羅と摩睺羅伽の両方が存在し、前者は通常の武神像、後者は五眼を持ち、琵琶を弾く像として表わされている。
sen.e: Among Nijuhachibushu there are both Hibakara and Makoraga, and the former is expressed as the statue of a war god while the latter is expressed as the statue who plays Japanese lute with five eyes.

Among Nijuhachibushu, there are both Hibakara and Makoraga, and the former is expressed as the statue of a war god while the latter is expressed as the statue who plays the Japanese lute with five eyes.
